intro: Erigeron cavernensis, commonly known as the cave fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the United States, particularly found in limestone caves and rocky areas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in low light conditions, adapting to the unique microclimates of its subterranean habitat. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in the spring and summer, attracting various pollinators. Erigeron cavernensis is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor environments, showcasing its resilience and specialized adaptations.
